reviewText:
Graphics:  Looks like everything was done in MS paint, even the text.
Audio: I suppose a 7-13 year old voicing sound effects is cute.
Music: The best thing in this game.
Controls:  In game controls work fine, controls for the menus are awkward
Mechanics:  Broken, enemies are instant kill and it is unclear due to the bad UI what your own health is.
Story: Did not play long enough to find out.
Entertainment: No.
Difficulty:  Getting past the loading screen.
Replayability: I rather get sprayed by a skunk.

reviewText:
Urizen Shadows of the Cold appears to be an interesting game based off of lore described on  its Steam store page.  It is presented well. However, this game implements 8-bit style graphics. While this can be done well, it was done poorly in this situation. It is butt-ugly. This game also does not allow keyboards to be used. This game is on the PC and should be able to do so. I do not own a joystick. As such, gameplay was not decent and the controls were very unintuitive. The music is present and seems to be decent, but I was only able to listen to the start menu music. This game does count towards number of steam games and has trading cards. As such, I would pay 50 cents for the game.

If you are reading this and are the developer, please add keyboard controls. I do want to try this game.

Note: I recieved a key for this game in a giveaway.
voteText: 7 of 7 people (100%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
Was asked to play for 10 minutes and write a review.
Run the game. It prompts you to press a button. Consequently press every button you have on your keyboard. The game eventually realizes you did press something and starts a slideshow with unreadable text on it. I waited for several minutes, but still failed to derive whether slides move on their own or in response to me pressing any particular button.
(Alt+F4 was my last resort. Oops, Alt+F4 doesn't work either. Had to fire it externally.)
Waited for 10 minutes, closed and uninstalled. 40 orlygift credits thrown away.

EDIT: Just realized from developer's comments that it is not even supposed to be played on keyboard, it's designed for X-BOX controllers. No idea what I'm doing here.

reviewText: First, you can't play with a keyboard. The gameplay needs several improvements. The commands in the menus are very awkward, but not bad in-game. The UI needs to be redesigned. I'd put the character slightly to the left, or in the side of the screen opposite to where I'm going. I don't like that I insta-kill the enemies, because it's not fun. Finally, sounds and graphics could be improved, because they aren't good at all.

reviewText:
I really like this game. It's not a triple A title, I believe it was developed by one guy, but I can tell he put a lot of love into it. I've only gotten past the second boss so far but am enjoying my time played!

It's a platform game that's doesn't try to throw any sort of gimmicky mechanics to it. It has a nice retro platformer feel to it. There's a huge variety of playable characters to choose from, each having a melee and a ranged weapon. These weapons seem to have slightly different functions for each character. For example, some of the ranged weapons' projectiles fire straight forward, some of them will lob/fall.

The levels are challenging and very few of them I was able to get through with out dying at least once. It becomes more challenging each level and new mechanics (like jump pads) are introduced at a nice pace.

The artwork may not seem that well polished to most people, but to me it's an amazing mix of retro and MS Paint, giving it a very unique feel. I especially like the artwork for the monsters. The music is catchy and appropriate.

It seems like the voice for the game is done by a child, which is off putting at first but eventually it sort of grew on me, especially when I started figuring out how to get combos and got to hear Amazing!"

My only major issue with the game is that you should make sure you save often
date: because for me at one point I did something wrong in one of the levels and lost my progress and had to start over a few levels back.  Also
recommended: make sure you have a controller for this game
hoursPlayed: because it does not support keyboard. That's fine by me though
voteText: I prefer using controllers for platforming games"

reviewText:
Product received for free

The game should have been an early access product
First,I got the game through a giveaway from Orlygift.com,since I did not purchase the game,I will leave it for you to decide if the game is worth the price

The game is far from finished,when the game was first released it didn't even had keyboard control.And now even with keyboard support,the controls are still broken.Some actions were delayed or just didn't responded.The control display weren't clear,I could only see half the keyboard controls(wasd for movement,J for jump and it only showed the upper half of the letter,I had to figure out on my own that k was for attack as least that's what I thought).

Here are the reasons why I would recommend this game
1.The developer somewhat listens to the community,which makes improvements for this game possible
2.Simple gameplay

Here are the reasons why I won't recommend this game
1.Broken controls
2.Confusing controls
3.Neglect able story
4.Buggy gameplay
5.Outdated style
6.The game is barely playable
voteText: No ratings yet
